abstract: Buttes-Chaumont network, group of young, radical Muslim men in Paris that was once dismissed by some French authorities, has produced some of Europe's most militant jihadists; group's membership, strengthened in French penal system, included Cherif Kouachi, one of three terrorists who killed 17 people in Paris attacks; group's violent success raises fear that other homegrown groups in France may go unnoticed or be similarly dismissed.
lead_paragraph: Members of the group behind last week’s deadly terror attacks became known by the name of a park in a neighborhood that has produced some of Europe’s most militant jihadists.

byline.contributor: Aurelien Breeden contributed reporting from Paris, and Carlotta Gall from Algiers, Algeria.

snippet: Members of the group behind last week’s deadly terror attacks became known by the name of a park in a neighborhood that has produced some of Europe’s most militant jihadists.

headline.main: Jihadism Born in a Paris Park and Fueled in the Prison Yard
headline.print_headline: Jihadism Born in a Paris Park and Fueled in the Prison Yard
